wikipedia_page.main:
Paul William Monaghan (born 1965) is a Scottish National Party (SNP) politician who was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Caithness, Sutherland and Easter Ross from the 2015 general election until 2017, when he lost his seat to Jamie Stone of the Liberal Democrats.
Before beginning his political career, he gained a PhD in social policy then worked in various planning and management positions.

response: Thurso was elected Member of Parliament (MP) for Caithness, Sutherland and Easter Ross at the 2001 election and held the seat until he was defeated in the 2015 general election by SNP candidate Paul Monaghan. He was the fifth generation of the  to represent the Caithness area in the House of Commons. In 2016, he returned to the House of Lords after winning a by-election to fill a vacancy among the remaining Liberal Democrat hereditary peers.

Lord Thurso was sworn of the Privy Council in 2014.Lord Thurso was sworn of the Privy Council in 2014, gov.uk; accessed 8 May 2015. Thurso lost his Caithness, Sutherland and Easter Ross at the 2015 general election to Paul Monaghan of the Scottish National Party. However, Lord Thurso had a good result in comparison with many Liberal Democrat candidates. Only four Scottish Liberal Democrat candidates were closer to winning their seats, including Alistair Carmichael; who was the only Liberal Democrat candidate to retain his seat at that year's general election.

link_mentions.page: Caithness, Sutherland and Easter Ross (UK Parliament constituency)

response: Stone was elected as the Member of Parliament for Caithness, Sutherland and Easter Ross at the 2017 general election, defeating the incumbent SNP MP Paul Monaghan by 2,044 votes. On 16 June 2017, he was announced as the Liberal Democrat spokesman for Scotland. On 12 October 2017 he was transferred to the role of Armed Forces spokesman in a reshuffle.thumb|upright|Official parliamentary portrait, 2017
